Size: Up to 50 cm tall, usually under 20 cm.
Leaves: Hairless or sometimes hairy, flat, up to 15 cm long, very narrow.
Flowers: Dense cylindrical head of spikelets, 3-10 cm long with long bristles.
FruitSeeds: Seeds in groups of 3, with one awn.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinctive as a genus but very hard to distinguish individual species.
Impacts: Affect wool quality, awns can cause injuries to lambs, outcompetes native grasses.

Photos.Caption: Grows in Spring, dies in Summer
